questions.question: What is the purpose of good Samaritan laws?

choices.answer: To help protect people who voluntarily give care.
To protect people who give care that they are not trained in.
To discourage people from helping others
None of the above

questions.question: Person is responsive and showing signs of a life threatening condition, but doesn't consent to care. What should you do?

choices.answer: Do not give care, but cal 911
Give care and call 911
Do not give care and advise the person to recive medical help.
Give care, consent is not necessary

questions.question: The steps to follow in an emergency are?

choices.answer: Call Check Secure
Check Call Care
Care Call Check
Check Care Defibrillator

questions.question: In which situation should you call 911?

choices.answer: The person is having chest pain
The person is unresponsive
Having trouble breathing
All of the above

questions.question: Which of the following could signal an emergency?

choices.answer: Unusual behavior
Unusual odor
Unusual sound
All of the above

questions.question: When wearing latex free gloves, you should?

choices.answer: Avoid touching other surfaces
Wash hands after removing gloves.
Change gloves between people
All of the above

questions.question: You are conducting a check on a person who complains about a head injury, what should you do next?

choices.answer: Check injured leg
Get consent
Check to see if the person can bend the knee without pain.
All of the above

questions.question: About how many seconds should you check for breathing?

choices.answer: 5-10 seconds
less then 5 seconds
10-15 seconds
More than 15 seconds

questions.question: You see a woman collapse in front of you, she is not responsive, what should you do next?

choices.answer: Have somone else call 911 and get an AED, you begin CPR.
Put the woman in the recovery position.
Size up the scene.
Give two rescue breaths.

questions.question: When conducting a s.a.m.p.l.e interview, ask the person about all of the following except?

choices.answer: Whether the person has any medical conditions or allergies.
What was happening before
When they last had food or water
The persons age.

questions.question: When giving a rescue breath you should...

choices.answer: Blow hard and fast
Blow in for about 1 second and make the chest clearly rise
Blow harder if the chest does not rise
Give a breath that lasts for several seconds

questions.question: Causes of cardiac arrest in children and infants include:

choices.answer: Congenital Heart Disorders
Drowning
Traumatic injury's
All of the above

questions.question: A cycle of chest compression and rescue breaths in CPR is

choices.answer: 15 chest compression, 1 rescue breath
15 chest compression's, 3 rescue breaths
30 chest compression's, 1 rescue breaths
30 chest compression, 2 rescue breaths

questions.question: What care should you give to a responsive adult or child who is choking and cannot cough, speak or breathe?

choices.answer: Do a foreign object check/ removal
Give 2 slow rescue breaths
Give 5 back blows and 5 abdominal thrusts
Lower the person to the floor and open the airway

questions.question: You should continue CPR until:

choices.answer: Another trained responder or EMS personnel take over
The person shows an obvious sign of life
You are too exhausted to continue
All of the above

questions.question: What is the first link in the pediatric cardiac chain of survival

choices.answer: Early defibrillation
Early recognition and early access to ems
Prevention
Early CPR

questions.question: How should you care for a responsive infant who is choking and cannot cough, cry or breath?

choices.answer: Give abdominal thrusts.
Give back blows until the infant coughs
Give back blow and chest thrusts to clear the airway.
Open the infants mouth and clear the airway.

questions.question: To give chest compressions to an adult your hands should be placed..

choices.answer: In the middle of the chest
Just above the collar bone
On either side of the rib cage
On the lower tip of the breast bone

questions.question: Which of the following can be a sign or symptom of a heart attack?

choices.answer: Persistent chest pain or discomfort
Profuse sweating
Nausea or vomiting
All of the above

questions.question: Effective chest compressions....

choices.answer: Allow the chest to return to the normal position
Are delivered fast at a rate of 100-120 bpm.
Are smooth, regular and are given straight up and down
All of the above

questions.question: Care for a person who is unresponsive and has a blocked airway includes.

choices.answer: Giving chest compression's
Looking for an object between compression and breaths.
Pressing on the person abdomen about 5 inches deep
Both A and B

questions.question: When a cardiac arrest occurs, an AED should be used as soon as possible?

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: What are the benefits of early CPR and Defibrillation when a person is in cardiac arrest?

choices.answer: They can eliminate the need for advanced medical care.
They can reduce responder fatigue
They can give the person the best chance of survival
All of the above

questions.question: Which of the following statements of defibrillation is true?

choices.answer: It is an electric shock
It is commonalty used on a person complaining of chest pain
It is more likely to be successful without CPR
It is not a link in the cardiac chain of survival.

questions.question: if during the second analysis the AED advised against shock?

choices.answer: Check the pad placement
Reset the AED
Resume CPR until the AED reanalyzes
Unplug the connector from the machine.

questions.question: What should you do before the AED analyzes the heart rhythm?

choices.answer: Ensure that no one, including you, is touching the person
Ensure that the head tilt- jaw thrust is maintained
Ensure that the person is breathing
None of the above

questions.question: When preparing an AED for use, what is the first thing you should do?

choices.answer: perform 5 minutes of CPR
Deliver a shock
Stand clear
Turn on the AED

questions.question: The AED pads should normally be placed on:

choices.answer: The chest and stomach
The upper left and lower right sides of the chest
The upper right and lower left sides of the chest
The upper right and upper left sides of the chest

questions.question: Why is it important to stand clear and not touch the person while the AED is analyzing or defibrillating?

choices.answer: The AED will turn itself off
You or someone else could be injured by the shock
You might prevent the AED from analyzing the heart rhythm properly
Both Blue and Yellow

questions.question: If the AED pads risk touching each other (such as with a small child or an infant) you should:

choices.answer: Place them as usual. It does not matter if the pads touch each other
Place one pad on the stomach and one pad on the chest
Reverse the pads position on the chest
Place one pad in the middle pf the chest and the other on the back

questions.question: If alone, once you have turned on the AED, you should:

choices.answer: Apply the pads and allow the AED to analyze the heart rhythm
Check for movement and breathing
Give abdominal thrusts
Give chest compression's

questions.question: A woman burned her hand in the lunchroom. You should:

choices.answer: Cool the burn with cool water for at least 10 minutes
Cover the burn loosely with a dry, sterile dressing.
Remove her from the source of the burn
All of the above

questions.question: Which of the following statements about concussions is true:

choices.answer: A person with a concussion will always lose consciousness briefly
A person must have to be hit with a great deal of force
A concussion is a type of traumatic brain injury
It is safe for a person who has a concussion to immediately resume activity

questions.question: You are giving first aid to a person with a muscle, bone or joint injury.  EMS has been called.  What do you do?

choices.answer: Bandage the injured body part
Apply cold if the person can tolerate it and watch for shock
Splint the injury to immobilize it
All of the above

questions.question: When caring for a person who is having a seizure, you should:

choices.answer: Place something in b/w the persons teeth to prevent tongue biting
remove nearby objects that might cause injury
try to hold the person still
all of the above

questions.question: What sudden illness is usually caused by a blockage of blood flow to the brain?

choices.answer: Diabetic emergency
Heat-related illness
Heart Attack
Stroke

questions.question: A person is having a diabetic emergency and requests sugar.  The person is responsive. How much sugar should you give?

choices.answer: 10 grams
15 to 20 grams
25 grams
5 to 10 grams

questions.question: A person has signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion.  What should you do?

choices.answer: Have the person quickly drink large amounts of cool water
Get the person out of the heat and into a cooler place
Immerse the person up to the neck in ice water
Call 9-1-1 or the designated emergency number

questions.question: A person is having signs and symptoms of a heart attack.  What should you do first?

choices.answer: Have the person chew an aspirin tablet
Call 9-1-1 or the designated emergency number
Help the person rest in a comfortable position and loosen tight clothing
Begin CPR

questions.question: Which of the following statements about anaphylaxis is true?

choices.answer: A person experiencing anaphylaxis may have trouble breathing
It is important to act quickly
The effects can be stopped or slowed by giving epinephrine
All of the above

questions.question: In what circumstance would it be appropriate to use a tourniquet?

choices.answer: There are multiple people with life threating injuries who need care
The person has a bleeding chest wound
You do not have dressings and bandages available
You cannot access a pressure point to apply pressure

questions.question: When using direct pressure to control non-life threatening bleeding from an open would, you should:

choices.answer: Lift the dressing every minute to see if bleeding has stopped
Remove and replace dressings as they become saturated with blood
Use a hemostatic dressing
add additional dressings and continue to apply direct pressure

questions.question: You believe that a person has a head, neck or spinal injury.  What should you do?

choices.answer: Remove the persons safety helmet
Have the person remain in the position until EMS personnel arrive
Put the person in the recovery position
Have the person nod the head up & down & shake the head to check for pain

questions.question: Which of the following could be signs or symptoms of stroke?

choices.answer: Drooping features on one side of the face
Trouble with speech or language
An arm that drifts downward when both arms are lifted in front
all of the above

questions.question: A person is having an asthma attack.  What should you do?

choices.answer: Have the person sit down and take deep breaths
Give the person a cool drink
Encourage the person to use their inhaler & call 911 if it does not improve
Help the person use his or her epi-pen

questions.question: Which of the following could cause shock?

choices.answer: A burn
A wound that is bleeding heavily
Anaphylaxis
All of the above
